item.title: Adding Database Migrations for Entity Framework Core
item.description: So, you have already added new entities into the Domain project, modified an existing entity or want to recreate all the pre-generated migrations? Here is how to proceed. Note that currently, fullstackhero’s Web API supports the following major DB Providers, MSSQL MySQL PostgreSQL Oracle Download links to setup the supported Database providers are mentioned here - https://fullstackhero.net/dotnet-webapi-boilerplate/general/development-environment/ To maintain scalability, the database migrations of each of these DB Providers are kept in separate class library projects namely

item.title: Setting up Azure AD Authentication
item.description: For the Azure AD integration to work with this template, you have to create 2 App Registrations under your Azure AD tenant with the right settings, and then fill out the AzureAd section in Configurations/security.json to hook those apps up. This guide will walk you through doing all that. Create the FSHApi Application Registration # Log into the azure portal and go to the Azure Active Directory blade. Make sure you are in the directory where you want your apps to be registered.
